title: Welcome to Our New Website
excerpt: We're excited to launch our new parish website with enhanced features for our community.
content:
We're delighted to introduce our new parish website, designed to better serve our community and provide easy access to information about our services, events, and parish life.

The new site features:
- Improved accessibility for all users
- Mobile-responsive design
- Easy-to-find Mass times and events
- Online content management for parish staff
- Enhanced photo galleries and news updates

We hope this new platform will help strengthen our parish community and make it easier for everyone to stay connected with what's happening at St Saviour's.

If you have any feedback or suggestions, please don't hesitate to contact the parish office.
author: Parish Office

title: Lenten Programme 2025
excerpt: Join us for our special Lenten journey with additional services, talks, and spiritual opportunities.
content:
As we prepare for the holy season of Lent, St Saviour's is offering an enriching programme of spiritual activities to help you grow closer to Christ.

Our Lenten Programme includes:
- Daily Mass with special Lenten reflections
- Stations of the Cross every Friday at 7:30 PM
- Weekly Lenten talks by guest speakers
- Confession available before all evening services
- Special children's Lenten activities

Additional Services During Lent:
- Ash Wednesday Masses: 7:30 AM, 12:15 PM, 7:00 PM
- Palm Sunday: Procession begins at 9:45 AM
- Holy Week services with full schedule to follow

We encourage all parishioners to embrace this holy season through prayer, fasting, and almsgiving. Join us as we journey together towards Easter.
author: Fr Krisz

title: First Holy Communion Registration
excerpt: Registration is now open for children to begin their First Holy Communion preparation.
content:
We are delighted to announce that registration is now open for the First Holy Communion programme for children in Year 3 and above.

Programme Details:
- Weekly sessions starting in March 2025
- Saturday mornings 10:00 AM - 11:30 AM
- Parent and child sessions
- First Holy Communion celebration in June 2025

What's Included:
- 12 weeks of preparation sessions
- Take-home materials and activities
- Special retreat day
- First Holy Communion ceremony
- Certificate and commemorative gifts

Requirements:
- Child must be in Year 3 or above
- Regular Mass attendance
- Parent/guardian commitment to attend sessions
- Completed registration form

To register, please contact the parish office or collect a form from the back of the church. Places are limited and allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

For more information, speak to Fr Krisz or call the parish office.
author: Parish Office
